description:
Bicycle drivetrains have remained unchanged for decades. Yes, advancements like electronic gears and oversized pulley wheels have improved things, but the basic principle of a cassette and chain have been around for years. So, when Ollie & Alex read about New Motion Labs new chain design that could be several percent more efficient than a traditional drivetrain, they  were particularly excited. In this week‚Äôs GCN Tech show, we‚Äôre talking about the future of drivetrain technology!

Get involved with this week's GCN Tech Show over on the GCN App!

description:
Pro cycling often looks glamorous; descending through the Alps at the Tour de France, or climbing the Dolomites in the spring at the Giro! But there's a gritty side we often don't see where helper riders or 'domestiques' serve their team mates by carrying bottles from the team car to the front of the race. To celebrate these unsung heroes we've come up with a challenge to test our presenters skills and demonstrate just how hard it is to be a team player at a Grand Tour!

description:
In 1984, Shimano revolutionised how cyclists change gear. Shimano's indexed shifting, or SIS, meant riders could confidently and quickly shift gear on their bike without having to make fine adjustments on the fly whilst trying to race! In this video, Alex gives you a run down of what SIS actually is, and how it changed cycling forever!

description:
This is the future of urban mobility. This is the answer to all of our problems. This is The Drycycle. This EAPC (Electrically Assisted Pedal Cycle) is, as far as legislation is concerned, a bicycle - and may just be the solution to the issues caused in urban environments by heavy, polluting cars. In this video, Si challenges Hank to the ultimate city cycling challenge to see if the Drycycle really is the future.

description:
From amateur cyclists to elite racers, everyone has heard of Shimano, and most of us ride bikes equipped with their technology. To celebrate the company's 100-year anniversary, we partnered up to take a look back at some of their most groundbreaking cycling innovations over the years. From indexed shifting with SIS, integrated brake and shift levers with STI, and more recently electronic shifting with Di2 - there are countless examples of Shimano innovation changing the face of cycling tech.

description:
We were lucky enough to get our hands on this vintage 1986 La Vie Claire Look. This retro race bike would have been ridden by the likes of Bernard Hinault and Greg Lemond, along with the rest of the iconic La Vie Claire squad. Complete with a 7 speed, 13-19 freewheel, Cinelli Champion du Monde bars, and Ambrosio Metamorphosis rims, this is a true blast from the past. What do you think of the polarising La Vie Claire paint job? Hot or not? Let us know in the comments below!
